greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Digital complement of n (replace each nonzero digit d with 10-d).
comment: a(n) = -n in carryless arithmetic mod 10 - that is, n + a(n) = 0 (cf. A169894). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 03 2010
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
David Applegate, Marc LeBrun and N. J. A. Sloane, Carryless Arithmetic (I): The Mod 10 Version.
Index entries for sequences related to carryless arithmetic
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
maple: for i from 1 to nops(t1) do
mathematica: a[n_] := FromDigits[ IntegerDigits[n] /. d_?Positive -> 10-d]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 100}](* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 28 2011 *)
program: a055120 = foldl f 0 . reverse . unfoldr g where
f v d = if d == 0 then 10 * v else 10 * v + 10 - d
g x = if x == 0 then Nothing else Just $ swap $ divMod x 10
def A055120(n): return int(''.join(str(10-int(d)) if d != '0' else d for d in str(n))) # _Chai Wah Wu_, Apr 03 2021
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Apr 19 2000
